ACDI/VOCA is currently seeking a Specialist in Communications for an upcoming Service Learning Corps Assignment in Bangladesh. ACDI/VOCA’s Feed the Future Livestock and Nutrition Activity requests a Service-Learning Corps Volunteer to coordinate and collaborate with the LAN project staff, Learning and Adaptation (CLA) team and Communications Manager, Technical Team Leads, Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) team, and the home office team to conceptualize and develop methodologies to further develop the communication agenda and operationalize it by producing story ideas for videos, success stories, and other appropriate communication products that effectively communicates LAN results. The selected SLC volunteer will review project documents, contribute to various LAN reports, participate in meetings, engage, and participate in stakeholder forums to identify and operationalize communication needs. This assignment will last for approximately 3 months.

Provisions for the Volunteer All international and local travel Lodging and Meals, Travel Visa (if applicable), Emergency Medical Insurance, In-country support from field office staff.

Assignment Tasks

While in-country, the Volunteer will

Review the LAN communication plan to ensure alignment with the organizational mission and programs. This will involve analysis of the relevant project documents considering all the steps through which programs are evaluated, identifying project stakeholders, analyzing the communication needs of each stakeholder.
Implement LAN communication strategy that includes media outreach and social media content creation.
Work closely with field staff in writing, editing, and review, and coordinate distribution of information to promote and the visibility of project accomplishments for specific county activities.
Support county LAN teams in the documentation and repackaging reports for wider consumption.
Identify program areas that require stronger and effective communication interventions. This will include designing and implementing specific communication tasks/actions through different channels – LAN newsletter, program website, etc. .
Provide creative support for internal and external communication including print publications, electronic communication, and community engagement.
Qualifications
Graduate/Ph.D. student or recent graduate in Communications, International Development or another related program.
Expertise (work or educational experience) in Communications Strategy and Social Media Campaigns.
Proficient computer skills including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Teams, WhatsApp, and Zoom.
Knowledge of Graphic Design applications (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.
The ability to identify and develop program Success Stories through co-creation with program partners and other local stakeholders.
Previous experience working in Asia is preferred but not required.

Job Description

Purpose of the Role:

The Administration Manager is responsible to fulfill the operational and IT needs of Dhaka Office. The person will be responsible to manage Office facilities, Lease/ contract agreement, Vendor management, Fleet management, Event management, Budget preparation and utilization, Logistics support, Coordination & liaison with program team and staff supervision. The person with work under Deputy Director of Operations and will work closely with the operations team Field Offices (Cox’s Bazar & Ukhiya).

Highlights Of Key Responsibilities

Operation and Admin support:
Ensure and manages office facilities that essentially include timely payment of rental, electricity, water, drainage, visibility considering well-being of staffs
Manage office maintenance work and act as housekeeping focal for Dhaka Office
Responsible for working on the office improvement for Dhaka Office. Ensure office maintenance work as necessary.
Responsible to ensure office stationaries/ supplies/ consumable items for office and make appropriate plan for next quarter.
Responsible to make contract/ lease agreement and ensure rental payment has paid on time as per contract and update if necessary.
Ensure logistics support to training, meeting, workshop in Dhaka level as and when necessary.
Responsible to ensure that the generators are functional, and ensure repair, maintenance, servicing has done on time.
Ensure repair maintenance of office equipment and furniture as needed.
Ensure proper operational support in response to the program request and their priorities.
Ensure renovation work (if any) of the premises / facilities as needed.
Travel And Accommodation
Ensure vehicle support to staff/ CD and others senior management as per request.
Ensure all logistics for international staff (incoming/ outgoing)
Support to staff for their travel related issues from/ to Dhaka Office
Ensure accommodation and others support for staff based on approved TOR/ TAF
Coordinate with Cox’s Bazar and Ukhiya operation team related to any staff travel and accommodation issues.
Supply Chain And Fleet
Responsible to utilize operation budget and make plan to ensure that the PR has submitted to supply chain well ahead under OADM (Dhaka).
Liaison with Supply Chain team to ensure office supplies are smooth and on time delivery to office and field facilities.
Ensure office supplies and services are under MSA/ MPA and develop suppliers to get supplies as monthly basis check payment.
Ensure office store, stationery and consumables are keep accurate record in store and dispatch with proper documentation.
Information Technology (IT) Support
Ensure internet facilities are available in Dhaka office and IT support to staff as needed.
Ensure hardware and software are regularly maintained and reviewed with replacement by coordination with IT and Asset team
Ensure Dhaka office IT infrastructure is suitable to support for Dhaka based staffs and operational needs
Ensure all IT assets are recorded properly with IRC standard procedure and update regularly
Support and coordinate with Cox’s Bazar and Ukhiya IT team as when needed.
Staff Supervision And Development
Provide encouraging mentorship and supervision to direct reports. Provide appropriate and timely feedback to support staff regarding their performance, including timely implementation of the regular check in, annual staff performance management system.
Maintain open and professional relations with team members, promoting a strong team spirit and providing oversight and guidance to enable staff to successfully perform in their positions.
Others
Ensure security of IRC Dhaka Office and follow up security guard’s performance in coordination with Security team.
Consult and make recommendations together with the Operations/ Security Coordinator on Dhaka office security and administrative issues
Ensure compliance with IRC policies and practice with respect to PSEA, safeguarding, code of conduct, safety and security, anti-harassment, and other relevant policies and procedures.

Major Challenges/Difficulties Of This Role
Balancing multiple priorities in a dynamic and high demanding work environment.
Smooth coordination and communication with Operations, Finance, IT and Supply chain team.
Prioritizing workload to ensure effective operations performance & delivery to staff need.
Deliverables
Manage entire operations includes procurement, logistics, inventory, and IT functions.
Manage operations budget preparation, expenditure monitoring and reporting
Ensure safety & security of office premise, assets, and human resources as per IRC Standard.
Ensure facilities management and equipment maintenance as per IRC workplace standards
Monthly operational reporting’s
People’s management
Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of experience in Logistics/Operations/Administration/IT
Experience of working with UN Agencies or Non-Governmental organizations.
Competencies: Knowledge, Skills & Ability:
Advanced level skills in MS Office suite (MS Word, Excel, Outlook, Power point). Knowledge of BvA/ERP systems to accomplish day to day activities would be an asset
Excellent interpersonal and English communication skills to work in a multicultural setting
Proven track record of representing organization to external stakeholders and coordination
Experience of managing oversight of logistics, procurement, administrative and office management
Ability to resolve problem by working with internal and external stake holders in a participatory approach
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and execute tasks in a high-pressure work environment
Highly adaptive to work in constant change environment independently where revision to projects and planning is common phenomenon
Highly comfortable to work in a most diverse feminist work culture with complying with GEDI principles
Comfortable to working in a team environment to achieve shared goal and passions for humanitarian work
Language Preference

Let your passion fly! We’re proud to be one of the world’s leading airlines. Our reputation is built on a long track record of success, an ongoing commitment to our home Hong Kong, and the delivery of customer service that’s straight from the heart. All of this is possible due to our talented people who share our passion for aviation and our commitment to being the best. Our global family can open up a world of opportunities for you. This means that your first role at Cathay Pacific won’t be your last. It could take you anywhere. Join us and discover just how far you can go!

Role Introduction

Purpose

To assist with operational and reservation functions for the port including oversight of suppliers to ensure compliance to Cathay service levels and regulatory requirements.

To ensure the highest standards of safety during ground handling of the aircraft and to achieve on-time performance.

To provide support to port management to drive service excellence and delivery of the cargo services strategy

Key Responsibilities

Key responsibilities and tasks

Customer Service

Support cargo reservations and bookings whilst providing exemplary customer service
Provide timely vendor notification for on-time and delayed flights
Provide timely shipment status updates to customers
Help to manage Ground Handling Agent performance and provide guidelines and instructions
Support the established performance targets through operational oversight and participation

Administrative Support

Prepare flight documentation for crew and Customs
Check and review post-flight documentation
Prepare post-flight reports in a timely and accurate manner
Provide freighter catering uplift and last-minute changes
Coordinate effectively between engineering, airport operations, air traffic control and vendors to ensure smooth communication and service provision
Coordinate cargo service activities between sales, operations and ground handling in order to ensure efficient handling of shipments
Communicate effectively via various channels stakeholders including customers, airport and cargo operations, suppliers, flight crew etc.
Assist with various administrative station tasks such as SAP
Coordinate weather diversions at diversion sites
Handle diversion of Cathay Pacific Flights when required
Assist with crew administration and support matters at the port
Support station training activities as required
Support station management in supplier oversight including reporting Ground Handling Agent performance issues
Any other reasonable task as requested

Ramp Coordinator (RCO) - note typically for Freighter ports so may not be applicable for every Cargo Services Officer role

Monitor and ensure the required procedures are properly carried out by Ramp Handling Operator and the Cargo Terminal Operator particularly for special cargo, movement of in/out cargo and mail units on an ad-hoc basis, loading and unloading of the freighter, etc.
Monitor the optimisation of space utilisation for loaded Unit Load Devices and the belly of freighters
Ensure aircraft searches required by the Security Programme are conducted prior to loading
Maintain good communications with captain-in-command, Ramp Handling Operator, Cargo Terminal Operator and the Cargo Office
Liaise closely with the Cargo Office to provide up to date information on freighter positioning when there is disruption of schedule
Quickly resolve issues on the ramp as required
Ensure safe operations are maintained at times particularly during loading and unloading of freighters
Assess the cause of any delay and provide recommendations to the immediate supervisor on accountability for the cause and solution
Monitor the acceptance and release of such special cargo as animals, engines, vehicles, bulky shipments, and odd-sized items
Coordinate the activities in the warehouse and conduct quality checks on cargo handling from the Cargo Terminal Operator and the Ramp Handling Operator
Any other reasonable task as requested

Safety, Security and Compliance

Help to ensure compliance and conformance to all regulatory and internal safety, security, quality, and procedural requirements
Undertake quality check programs established by Head Office and participate in audits as required
Support the Emergency and Accident role as required
May be designated Operational Duty Holder for the station as required

Emergency and Accident

Emergency and Accident and Crisis Response responsibilities as required

Academic qualifications

Degree in any field is a minimum
Diploma / Certification in a relevant business field would be an advantage

Knowledge, Skills, Training, And Experience

Minimum of 2 years’ cargo or airline operations
Prior customer service experience is an advantage
Good decision making and planning skills
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work independently
Attention to detail
Ability to multi-task

Job Purpose

The Country Economist (CE) is the key RH team member to ensure a successful country engagement. The CE technically leads the Member Country Partnership Strategy (MCPS) and Country Engagement Framework (CEF) formulation process and provides all the needed support and coordination to ensure the delivery of high-quality MCPS and CEF processes and their constituting documents. This entails coordinating and finetuning all the inputs from internal and external stakeholders.

Technical support to all Regional Hub strategic, operational, and programming engagements with MCs, including reviewing and mapping the potential macroeconomic and sectoral impact on the existing IsDBG portfolio. Moreover, the CE regularly reviews the MCs' new policies, strategies, and national development plans to guide the Regional Hub’s programming in line with the MCs’ priority sectors and areas for intervention.

Act as the knowledge and Resource Centre for the IsDB Group for their economic and development solutions by providing an overview of country-level macro-economic data, developmental trends, and thematic and sector information.

Review the assistance strategies of major development partners and their sectors/themes of focus, in addition to capturing the status and potential of coordination between IsDB and other development partners.

Participate in discussions with MCs governments and other developmental partners to identify collaboration opportunities that address Member Countries’ needs/priorities and align with IsDB’s strategy.

Key Accountabilities

Planning & Programming

Lead the preparation of MCPS and CEF and relevant multi-task teams to ensure their effective formulation and implementation.
Lead the preparation of MCPS mid-term implementation review and MCPS completion review to provide portfolio performance, implementation progress and lessons learned.
Provide inputs and participate in Programming, Economic Sector Work (ESW), and Country Diagnostic Studies (CDS).
Support the preparation of project documents from an economic perspective through providing inputs in country context and economic update as well as review economic and financial analysis of projects.
Engage, communicate, and collaborate with the broader team in the Bank in order to enhance the rigor of and advice on cross-cutting and sectoral issues in the MCs.
Regularly reviews the MCs' new policies, strategies, and national development plans to guide the Regional Hub’s programming in line with the MCs’ priority sectors and areas for intervention.
Participate in discussions with MCs governments and other developmental partners to identify collaboration opportunities that address Member Countries’ needs/priorities and align with IsDB’s strategy.

Analysis And Review

Prepare and review, country-level macro-economic reports, developmental trends, and thematic and sector information.
Analyze macroeconomic data in the project documentation prepared in collaboration with COM, OTLs, and PMSs.
Review regularly and map macroeconomic issues and sectoral impact on the existing IsDBG portfolio.
Conduct analytical work and identify developmental challenges in the MCs as part of the MCPS and how IsDB can address them.
Design a Monitoring & Evaluation Framework (M&E Framework) for all concerned activities to assess the effectiveness and impact of MCPS and CEF.
Review the assistance strategies of major development partners and their sectors/themes of focus, in addition to capturing the status and potential of coordination between IsDB and other development partners.

Knowledge Building And Sharing

Monitor and assess emerging challenges and trends in the MCs.
Contribute to transferring knowledge of local economic insights from MCs to other CEs and employees within IsDBG.
Contribute, coordinate, and represent in annual and periodic events conducted by the Regional Hub, such as: Seminars, Regional Workshops, and capacity-building workshops.

Reporting

Act as an advocate and reference on all economic reports related to the MCs in the Regional Hub.
Engage, communicate, and collaborate with the interdisciplinary teams in the Bank to enhance the rigor and advice on cross-cutting and thematic issues in MCs.
Lead the periodical preparation of Country Briefs.
Contribute to the preparation of the Regional Hub of Dhaka for the IsDB Group Annual Meeting and quarterly preparation of Country Briefs and Talking Points.
Contribute to the engagement of the Hub Manager and Higher Management including talking points / Press Statements with government officials and equivalent contacts with other international organizations, partner entities, and other external constituencies, Press and expert groups.
Conduct peer review and provide feedback on all economic reports/data prepared by peers Economists within CP Directorate.

Education, Experience & Certification

Master’s degree in Economics, International Development or related field.
Minimum 7 years of experience as an economist, of which 3 years in a multilateral development bank or relevant experience at the Ministry of Finance/ Economic Planning/ Central Bank, etc.

Skills & Necessary Knowledge

Advanced Analytical Thinking
Proficient Statistical Theory Knowledge
Proficient in R, Python, Stata or EViews
Proficient Knowledge of Emerging Economies’ Issues
Proficient Economic Modeling Skills
Proficient Econometric Modeling Skills
Proficient Multidimensional Indicator Development Skills
Proficient Operational Modeling Skills

Languages

English (Mandatory)

About Augmedix

Augmedix (Nasdaq: AUGX) delivers industry-leading, ambient medical documentation and data solutions to healthcare systems, physician practices, hospitals, and telemedicine practitioners.

Augmedix is on a mission to help clinicians and patients form a human connection at the point of care without the intrusion of technology. Augmedix’s solutions extract data from natural physician-patient conversations and convert it to medical notes in real time, which are seamlessly transferred to the EHR. To achieve this, the company’s Ambient Automation Platform uses Automated Speech Recognition and Natural Language Processing, supported by medical documentation specialists.

Leveraging this platform, Augmedix’s solutions relieve clinicians of administrative burden, in turn, reducing burnout and increasing both clinician and patient satisfaction. Augmedix is also leading the revolution in leveraging point-of-care data by making connections between millions of physician-patient interactions and analyzing them to deliver actionable insights that elevate patient care.

Since 1963 and in 148 countries, ACDI/VOCA has empowered people in developing and transitional nations to succeed in the global economy. Based in Washington, D.C., ACDI/VOCA is a nonprofit international development organization that designs and delivers technical and management solutions in agriculture, economic growth, and resilience to promote economic prosperity and social inclusion.

Director of Finance and Administration, USDA Food for Progress, Bangladesh

We are currently seeking expressions of interest for long-term Director of Finance and Administration (DFA) for the anticipated 3-year Food for Progress program funded by USDA in Bangladesh. The Activity will focus on support and facilitation of the adopting climate smart techniques and technologies in the Bangladesh livestock sector. The Activity will assist farmers to increase production and improve incomes while conserving the land resources required for livestock production and reducing emissions through a) incorporation of climate smart technologies in the livestock sector, b) improved animal health management practices, c) strengthening of extension and service providers, and d) coordinate with the Government of Bangladesh (GOB) and other donors to increase technical expertise in climate smart livestock value chains within the GOB. The position will be based in Dhaka and is envisioned to start in 2023.

ACDI/VOCA seeks a dynamic and progressive professional who brings technical expertise in livestock, agriculture and/or commodity programs. The DFA will provide leadership and direction to the finance and operations team with close oversight of the project’s finances, including financial analysis and accounting management.

Develop, oversee, and monitor all financial and accounting systems, policies, procedures, and internal controls, adapting them as necessary to meet changing regulations and best practices
Establish and maintain efficient financial and operational systems and processes including internal audits, compliance, and risk management
Lead the annual budgeting process and review all financial plans and budgets, monitoring progress and changes
Prepare and execute action plans to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of finance and administrative operations and to mitigate operational and compliance risks
Periodically assess the efficiency and effectiveness of finance and administration procedures in relation to the delivery of technical activities on time and at optimum cost
Ensure that Program funds are utilized compliantly and appropriately by the close of the fiscal year
Comply with all USDA rules and regulations and ACDI/VOCA policies and procedures relating to finance and administration, including but not limited to preparing budgets, financial reports, etc.
Oversee annual financial audits of program and ensure that sub grantees comply with all audit and financial review requirements
Manage cash disbursement and petty cash account
Track USDA approvals for travel, hiring, and equipment procurements
Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, business administration, or related field is required; master’s degree is preferred.
Minimum 10 years of progressive work experience in financial control and audit related field including minimum 5 years of experience in a senior management position, providing administrative oversight and management systems development.
Knowledge of and experience with USDA and/or other international donor programs’ rules and regulations related to procurement and finance is required.
Experience working with financial institutions or private sector investors in Bangladesh a plus.
Fluency in English and Bangla languages required.

Bangladeshi nationals encouraged to apply.

Please apply online at www.acdivoca.org/international-jobs. The applications will be reviewed promptly upon receipt, only finalists will be contacted. ACDI/VOCA is an equal opportunity employer. Women, minorities, and people from diverse groups are encouraged to apply. ACDI/VOCA will never request payment or charge a fee to apply for any position.

University Research Co., LLC (URC)

In Our Interactions With Each Other And Our Clients, We Stay True To Our Values For Transformative Change By Focusing On

Guided by a strong vision of equitable and resilient systems that respond to people’s needs and emerging threats, URC helps countries and local actors to build, implement, and sustain science-driven, scalable solutions. Established in 1965, URC offers a range of technical expertise to empower governments, communities, and service providers toward strengthening their own health and social systems and improve service quality. We aim to expand access to and improve the quality of services, addressing maternal, newborn, child, and adolescent health; global health security and infectious diseases, including HIV/AIDS, TB, and malaria; reproductive health and family planning; nutrition and water, sanitation, and hygiene.

Creativity: by unleashing our creativity, we enhance engagement and interaction to improve problem-solving.
Collaboration: not only our work towards the same vision and mission instill staff with a strong sense of purpose, but also enables us to complement each other’s skills and allocate work to maximize everyone’s strengths.
Accountability: we hold ourselves responsible for accomplishing goals, completing assignments, and making decisions.
Diversity, equity, and inclusion: we embrace the importance of a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment, where our leadership and staff model behavior that enriches our organization, demonstrates respect for all people, and supports opportunities for all staff.
Transparency: we understand that when employees deeply trust one another and their leaders, they will be more engaged in their roles because they will not be worried about unfair treatment.

This position is contingent on funding.

Overview

URC is searching for an experienced Chief of Party for the anticipated five-year $10-24.99M USAID Bangladesh Systems Strengthening One Health Activity in Bangladesh. The purpose of the One Health Activity is to strengthen Bangladesh's Global Health Security architecture that will allow early detection of diseases in the animal, human, and environmental interfaces minimizing societal disruption, and prevent avoidable death. The activity will support three key objectives: 1) Strengthen Systems for Multi-Sectoral One Health Governance and Coordination; 2) Strengthen One Health Infectious Disease Surveillance and Laboratory Systems and 3) Reduced Threats of Antimicrobial Resistance.

Responsibilities

The Chief of Party/Project Director provides overall strategic and technical leadership and financial, management and administrative oversight. S/he has depth and breadth of technical expertise and experience in designing and implementing comprehensive public health interventions. S/he holds the requisite management expertise and established professional relationships to lead donor-funded programs and achieve impact. The COP/Project Director leads the Senior Management Team.

The roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Provide overall strategic vision, technical leadership, and oversight for the project.
Provide an appropriate balance of technical, managerial, and interpersonal skills to coordinate effective implementation of program activities, including development of a dynamic learning agenda and adaptive management approach.
Make programmatic decisions and troubleshoot implementation challenges; oversee program data quality compliance, including development of data tracking and monitoring systems USG or donor funding audit standards; and oversee sub-grant development, including compliance with programmatic objectives and URC\donor financial and administrative regulations.
Responsible for overall financial management and administration of the project; approve local financial transactions and authorize expenditures from local bank accounts; and approve all aspects of project procurement and logistics.
Serve as spokesperson and advocate, representing the project to the donor, central and local government officials, private sector leaders, and other stakeholders; will represent the project and URC at local, regional, and international fora.
Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the URC policies and applicable laws, including interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints; and resolving problems.

Qualifications

Master's degree in Public Health, Public Administration, Medicine, or a related field and a minimum of 7 years of progressively increasing responsibility, working on large-scale, complex international development and public health programs.
At least 10 years of relevant experience working in Bangladesh, or within the region, on public health programs for GHS, infectious diseases, AMR, and HSS, especially experience working with donor-funded projects
At least 10 years of relevant experience managing, designing and implementing similar, international, multi-million, donor- funded programs.
Supervisory experience involving leadership of professional and support staff; oversight and evaluation of staff performance and deliverables, and contract management.
Experience in managing donor-funded procurements and financial reporting.
Experience advising senior policymakers, host-country entities, including central and local governments, development partners, civil society and community-based organizations on health, nutrition, and related policies and devising standards, guidelines, and strategies and working with local/regional health authorities and communities to institutionalize activities.
Experience designing, managing, and implementing complex health activities, including in two of the following: GHS; HSS; AMR; and infectious disease in developing countries involving multiple stakeholders and implementing partners.
Demonstrated ability to provide oversight of local capacity development efforts.
Demonstrated experience strengthening service delivery and health systems.
Strong oral and written communication skills in English (Bengali preferred).

To Apply

Citizens of Bangladesh are encouraged to apply.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Unless otherwise directed, we will retain your CV in our database for future opportunities.

URC is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

We value and seek diversity in our workforce.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Country Director, the Deputy Country Director - Program Support (DCD – PS) provides leadership, direction and is responsible for Country Office (CO), Administrative and Operational Support processes and functions embracing Administration, IT, Procurement, Transport Services, Grants and Contracts and routine business security. Furthermore, the DCD - PS is required to play a substantive and essential hands-on role in the development or enhancement of CO systems, policy and processes across the spectrum of all CO departments, including within Finance, HR and Program.

The post requires exceptional, proactive, professional operational management skills and experience, coupled with the ability to make coherent and sometimes difficult decisions and/or recommendations to ensure program support is implemented efficiently and cost effectively, providing the highest quality services and information to “clients” at all the different levels of CARE, as well as for individuals, communities, donors and the stakeholders.

Ensure Core Organizational processes are viable and responsive to country office mission and program
Sets direction and takes responsibility for provision of overall strategic management across all PS & Operations functions (HR, Procurement, Administration, ICT, Transport, Safety and Security) and GAAM by providing strategic leadership and advice to Operations team.
Develop and organize activities of Program Support Department to provide timely and effective support to CO program to ensure objectives are met.
Provide support in the annual planning process and prioritize activities for the PS/Operations department.
Fosters links between Program and Program Support ensuring seamless coordination and support for program management.
Ensure PS/Operations strategies are integrated into the overall CO strategy, work with the senior management team to ensure that CARE has the appropriate staffing structures, optimum management systems, and support systems to implement high quality programming.
Lead business process improvements for the CO operations to bring about efficiency and effectiveness to the CO.

Responsible for staff performance management, development and talent management, capacity building of the PS/Operations team and the CO.
Ensure human and material resources are effectively and efficiently obtained and made available for the sound execution of CO program and operations.
In collaboration with program team ensure effective award and sub grant management including due diligence review, capacity building and implementation of preventive/corrective actions.
Policy and Operations Systems Development, Review and Implementation
Initiate new, revise existing PS/operations policies, systems and procedures in-line organization global/regional policies along with the legal and donor requirements in Bangladesh.
Lead on process efficiencies through implementation of ERP business system for all program support functions.

Ensure sound internal control systems are in place and functioning to ensure adherence to policies and procedures
Ensures the consistent and uniform implementation of the Policy and Procedures throughout the CO to ensure the accomplishment of the CO deliverable;
Coordinate with management on legal matters in the CO, work with Asia Regional Management Unit (ARMU), CARE USA legal and in Country legal advisor.
Work with Country Director and DCD-Programs to ensure that PS/operation policies, systems and procedures are supportive in program implementation.
Work closely with Deputy Regional Director - Program Support on roll-out of global policies and processes.
Tracks and trouble shoots business units performance ensuring appropriate remedies and adjustments
Responsible for achieving all program support related performance indicators from CO performance dashboard.
Consistently tracks business process unit’s performance against key performance targets and provides guidance for necessary improvement and adaptation.
Support procurement and other project teams in timely trouble-shooting system (PEOPLESOFT) related issues.
Coach project team on systems (PEOPLESOFT) software as needed on procurement function.
Coordination of functional units operations budgets in line with agreed plans.
Approve and ensure spending of PS/Operations budget is in line with donor requirement.

Support program teams to ensure donor compliance for all projects and programs under existing and new donors.
Provide input including operational risk analysis and recommendations to the Country Director related to effectiveness of CO reporting and planning systems.
Team Management and Leadership
Oversee legal, statutory relations and ensure a viable program support structureOversee legal, statutory relations and ensure a viable program support structure.
Continuous trend analysis of risk and effective management
Provide proper supervision and management for all direct reports and lead the establishment and functioning of a strong, effective and coordinated team.
Ensure the proper and timely implementation of CARE’s performance management systems for direct reports including job description, regular feedback, midterm reviews and annual performance appraisals.
Proactively address performance issues through regular, and constructive feedback and coaching; identify necessary staff development, and career development strategies for direct reports.
Ensure across the board compliance with organizational, donor and (host) government rules and regulations.
Ensure the effective and efficient implementation of PeopleSoft (CAREs financial software) at all applicable levels of PS/Operations.

About IREX:

IREX is an independent nonprofit organization dedicated to building a more just, prosperous, and inclusive world by empowering youth, cultivating leaders, strengthening institutions, and extending access to quality education and information. Founded in 1968, IREX has an annual portfolio of over $100 million, works in more than 100 countries worldwide, and a global staff of 600.

Summary of Position:

IREX seeks qualified short-term consultant candidates to drive an assessment to prepare for an upcoming donor-funded youth empowerment program in Bangladesh. The estimated level of effort for this individual is 10 days between July – September 2022. Leveraging an existing network of key local stakeholders and relevant technical expertise in economic empowerment (preferred experience with private sector linkages), the Dhaka-based consultant will identify a wide range of key stakeholders including government, private sector, youth led, and youth serving organizations and conduct meetings to gather contextual inputs to inform the design of the upcoming program as well as identify potential partners and key personnel to drive implementation.

Only citizens of Bangladesh or residents with work authorization will be considered.

Summary of Responsibilities:

Assist in finalizing the assessment framework; develop a shortlist of key stakeholders for consultation and interview questions
Set meetings, conduct consultations with key stakeholders, and provide regular updates via check-ins with the team in HQ
Organize and facilitate focus groups, capturing inputs from participants
Compile notes from each meeting and assessment takeaways in final report
Remain attentive to context and learnings throughout consultancy and adjust assessment approach if needed
Conduct desk review of IREX-provided documents to inform assessment
Develop initial ideas for project design and partnering strategy based on information collected and knowledge of context
Other duties, as assigned

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Master’s degree in a relevant field such as education, international development, non-profit management, etc., with at least six (6) years of relevant experience (or bachelor’s degree with 8 years of experience) supporting youth empowerment programs focused on civic education, youth leadership and development, and/or employment/entrepreneurship preferred
Successful track record of conducting assessments (with strong preference for experience with past USG-funded projects) and/or project design in support of new business development
Ability to professionally present IREX to key stakeholders on the ground
A successful track record of working substantially with local organizations and partners
A minimum of four (4) years of experience in Bangladesh
Strong understanding of the Bangladesh context required
Ability to establish strong working relationships with senior government officials, educators, schools, youth-led groups, community officials, civil society, international donors, and other stakeholders
Demonstrated excellent written and oral skills
Proven organizational qualities and excellent management skills
Preferred experience consulting for USAID
Strong representational and organizational skills
Fluency in written and spoken English

Finance and Operations Director – Systems Strengthening for One Health Activity

Are you passionate about improving quality of life through accessible public health services? Then consider ICF, we work at the forefront of today’s global health issues, helping clients understand the specific needs of diverse populations and address complex health challenges with behavior and disease surveillance and monitoring, research and surveys, technical assistance, and organizational capacity building support.

ICF is a mission-driven company filled with people who care deeply about improving the lives of others and making the world a better place. Our core values include Embracing difference, we seek candidates who are passionate about building a culture that encourages, embraces, and hires dimensions of difference.

Job Description

ICF is growing and we’re currently hiring a Finance and Operations Director (FOD) for the anticipated five-year, USAID-funded Systems Strengthening for One Health Activity in Bangladesh. The purpose of this five-year project is to strengthen Bangladesh's Global Health Security architecture that will allow early detection of diseases in the animal, human, and environmental interfaces minimizing societal disruption, and prevent avoidable death. The activity will support three key objectives: 1) Strengthen Systems for Multi-Sectoral One Health Governance and Coordination; 2) Strengthen One Health Infectious Disease Surveillance and Laboratory Systems and 3) Reduced Threats of Antimicrobial Resistance. The position is anticipated to be based in Dhaka, Bangladesh beginning on or about October 2023.

The Finance and Operations Director will support the project team in their day-to-day management and administrative duties. The position will be based in Bangladesh but will require in country travel. Primary duties include budgeting, managing, and tracking of invoices and purchase orders, logistics management, and planning and tracking related to task order execution. He/she will oversee day-to-day operations and financial management of the project.

Responsibilities

The Director’s primary responsibilities would include ensuring overall compliance with ICF policies and USAID rules and regulations. The FOD manages all aspects of program operations and administration, providing effective support in finance, procurement, asset management, subcontractor management, security, project start up, and project close-out. The Finance and Operations Director will play a key role in supporting the COP to effectively achieve the results defined in the contract within budget. Responsibilities specifically include:

Ensure that all financial information is consolidated on time and provided to the COP as appropriate for analysis and dissemination.
Provide the management team with monthly financial reports including overall activity budget status (budget tracker), work plan budgets’ status and ensuring potential issues are identified and addressed.
Monitor effective oversight and support to recipients of sub-awards by the activity to ensure consistent compliance with the terms of their agreements including financial management and compliance with donor regulations.
Work with project leadership on project work plans, timelines, and logistics.
Support the tracking of staff and activity timelines and their completion.
Notify project leadership of impending delays, serving as the point of contact for staff traveling in-country in the event of resource needs or emergencies.
Monitor expenses against the program budget, and provide precise, detailed, reports during project start up and throughout implementation and close-out.
Liaise with ICF internal support functions (e.g., contracts and subcontracts) to ensure smooth flow of roles and responsibilities.
Work with project team on developing purchase orders for consultants and equipment, tracking invoices, and ensuring that all cost-related documents from outside the organization are managed.

job_title: Finance and Operations Director – One Health - Bangladesh
job_description:
Hours: Full-time Regular

Location: Dhaka, Bangladesh

Salary: Commensurate with required experience and qualifications

Reports to: Chief of Party/Project Director

University Research Co., LLC (URC)

In Our Interactions With Each Other And Our Clients, We Stay True To Our Values For Transformative Change By Focusing On

Guided by a strong vision of equitable and resilient systems that respond to people’s needs and emerging threats, URC helps countries and local actors to build, implement, and sustain science-driven, scalable solutions. Established in 1965, URC offers a range of technical expertise to empower governments, communities, and service providers toward strengthening their own health and social systems and improve service quality. We aim to expand access to and improve the quality of services, addressing maternal, newborn, child, and adolescent health; global health security and infectious diseases, including HIV/AIDS, TB, and malaria; reproductive health and family planning; nutrition and water, sanitation, and hygiene.

Creativity: by unleashing our creativity, we enhance engagement and interaction to improve problem-solving.
Collaboration: not only our work towards the same vision and mission instill staff with a strong sense of purpose, but also enables us to complement each other’s skills and allocate work to maximize everyone’s strengths.
Accountability: we hold ourselves responsible for accomplishing goals, completing assignments, and making decisions.
Diversity, equity, and inclusion: we embrace the importance of a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment, where our leadership and staff model behavior that enriches our organization, demonstrates respect for all people, and supports opportunities for all staff.
Transparency: we understand that when employees deeply trust one another and their leaders, they will be more engaged in their roles because they will not be worried about unfair treatment.

This position is contingent on funding.

Overview

URC is searching for an experienced Deputy Chief of Party/Deputy Project Director for the anticipated five-year $10-24.99M USAID Bangladesh Systems Strengthening One Health Activity in Bangladesh. The purpose of the One Health Activity is to strengthen Bangladesh's Global Health Security architecture that will allow early detection of diseases in the animal, human, and environmental interfaces minimizing societal disruption, and prevent avoidable death. The activity will support three key objectives: 1) Strengthen Systems for Multi-Sectoral One Health Governance and Coordination; 2) Strengthen One Health Infectious Disease Surveillance and Laboratory Systems and 3) Reduced Threats of Antimicrobial Resistance.

Responsibilities

The Deputy Chief of Party (DCOP)/Deputy Project Director is responsible for the overall strategic and technical vision and implementation of the Systems Strengthening for One Health Activity. The skills and experience of the position complement those of the Chief of Party (COP)/Project Director, with an emphasis on health security expertise. This position is a member of the Senior Management Team.

The roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Directly assist the COP/Project Director in providing technical leadership for project implementation and course correction based on the creation and use of a learning agenda
Lead and manage the technical team, including managers and specialists
Accountable for the achievement of results, ensuring quality of technical assistance is maintained at the highest standards, and project technical objectives and deliverables are met in a timely manner.
Analyze complex data, identify trends, and make evidence-informed decisions while ensuring dissemination of technical learning across the program and amongst relevant external stakeholders.
Responsible for promoting partnership and multi-sectoral collaboration.
Responsible for timely submission of high-quality work plans, reports, and other products.
Provide high quality technical support to the central government with formulation and implementation of guidelines and policies.
Engage technical experts at URC home office and STTA consultants strategically to support achievement of the project objectives in a timely manner.

Qualifications

Master’s degree in Public Health, Medicine or related field
Minimum of 10 years of work experience that demonstrates technical expertise with substantial developing country context experience, in a combination of the following health security sub areas, including but not limited to: epidemiology, disease surveillance, outbreak investigation and response, emergency preparedness and response, biosafety and biosecurity, laboratory diagnostics, vaccine development, health system strengthening, anti-microbial resistance (AMR).
Minimum 8 years of demonstrated excellence in a management position in an international health and development context, including direct supervision of professional and support staff, quality evaluation of staff performance and deliverables, and contract/grant management.
Demonstrated understanding of the Bangladesh health security landscape and context
Demonstrated hands-on experience in building government, non-government, and community capacity to address health issues.
Demonstrated leadership capacity to build and lead technical teams.
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with senior-level officials particularly interacting productively, proactively, and comfortably with national and subnational government officials and institutions, NGOs, private sector groups, USAID, CSOs, and donor organizations.
Strong oral and written communication skills in English (Bengali preferred).

To Apply

Citizens of Bangladesh are encouraged to apply.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Unless otherwise directed, we will retain your CV in our database for future opportunities.

URC is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

We value and seek diversity in our workforce.

Since 1963 and in 148 countries, ACDI/VOCA has empowered people in developing and transitional nations to succeed in the global economy. Based in Washington, D.C., ACDI/VOCA is a nonprofit international development organization that designs and delivers technical and management solutions in agriculture, economic growth, and resilience to promote economic prosperity and social inclusion.

Director of Finance and Administration, Bangladesh Access to Finance Activity

ACDI/VOCA is seeking a Director of Finance and Administration for an anticipated access to finance program in Bangladesh funded by USAID. The program will increase access to finance for small- and medium-sized agribusinesses, smallholder farmers, and the rural poor to become more creditworthy, and stimulate increased lending from banks, microfinance institutions, and other lenders through the use of blended finance.

The Director of Finance and Administration will provide leadership and direction to the finance and operations team with close oversight of the project’s finances, including financial analysis and accounting management. The program is anticipated to start in 2023 and this position will be based in Dhaka, Bangladesh.

Develop, oversee, and monitor all financial and accounting systems, policies, procedures, and internal controls, adapting them as necessary to meet changing regulations and best practices
Establish efficient financial and operational systems including internal audits, compliance, and risk management
Lead the annual budgeting process and review all financial plans and budgets, monitoring progress and changes
Prepare and execute action plans to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of finance and administrative operations and to mitigate operational and compliance risks
Periodically assess the efficiency and effectiveness of finance and administration procedures in relation to the delivery of technical activities on time and at optimum cost
Ensure that Program funds are utilized appropriately by the close of the fiscal year
Comply with all USAID rules and regulations and ACDI/VOCA policies and procedures relating to finance and administration
Oversee annual financial audits of program and ensure that sub grantees comply with all audit and financial review requirements
Manage cash disbursement and petty cash account
Track USAID approvals for travel, hiring, and equipment procurement
Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, business administration, or related field is required; master’s degree is preferred.
Minimum 10 years of progressive work experience in financial control and audit related field including minimum 5 years of experience in a senior management position, providing administrative oversight and management systems development.
Knowledge of and experience with USAID and/or other international donor programs’ rules and regulations related to procurement and finance is required.
Experience working with financial institutions or private sector investors in Bangladesh a plus.
Fluency in English required, Bangla preferred.

Bangladeshi nationals are strongly encouraged to apply.

Please apply online at www.acdivoca.org/international-jobs. The applications will be reviewed promptly upon receipt, only finalists will be contacted. ACDI/VOCA is an equal opportunity employer. Women, minorities and people from diverse groups are encouraged to apply. ACDI/VOCA will never request payment or charge a fee to apply for any position.

Since 1963 and in 148 countries, ACDI/VOCA has empowered people in developing and transitional nations to succeed in the global economy. Based in Washington, D.C., ACDI/VOCA is a nonprofit international development organization that designs and delivers technical and management solutions in agriculture, economic growth, and resilience to promote economic prosperity and social inclusion.

Chief of Party, USDA Food for Progress, Bangladesh

We are currently seeking expressions of interest for a long-term Chief of Party (COP) for an anticipated 3-year Food for Progress program funded by USDA in Bangladesh. The Activity will focus on support and facilitation of the adopting climate smart techniques and technologies in the Bangladesh livestock sector. The Activity will assist farmers to increase production and improve incomes while conserving the land resources required for livestock production and reducing emissions through a) incorporation of climate smart technologies in the livestock sector, b) improved animal health management practices, c) strengthening of extension and service providers and d) coordinate with the Government of Bangladesh (GOB) and other donors to increase technical expertise in climate smart livestock value chains within the GOB. The position will be based in Dhaka and is envisioned to start in 2023.

ACDI/VOCA seeks a dynamic and progressive professional who brings technical expertise in livestock, climate smart agriculture. Experience with commodity programs is preferred but not required. The COP position will provide overall strategic direction in the design, management, implementation, and overall quality assurance of the program. The COP will manage a team of experts and support staff, prepare reports and annual operating plans, align project initiatives with in-country priorities and ensure the program is compliant with USDA and ACDI/VOCA regulations.

Develop strategic plans, annual and quarterly work plans, and overall management of the program in line with USDA guidelines to achieve the program objectives
Provide overall technical vision, leadership, and program management
Serve as the program’s key liaison with headquarters, USDA, program partners, government counterparts, private sector stakeholders, and other key stakeholders to exchange information and develop professional relationships
Ensure day-to-day technical, schedule, and financial performance of the project in accordance with the scope of work and annual work plans
Oversee management and quality of deliverables for all partners, consultants, and program staff
Collaboratively create and implement a strategic, long-term programmatic vision
Oversee preparation and supervision of project work planning, performance management, and strategic communications
Facilitate the development of sustainable public-private partnerships and private sector investment in target value chains
Review all financial and logistical information on a periodic basis
Give verbal or written presentations as requested by the client and/or ACDI/VOCA to varied audiences regarding the program’s progress
Advanced degree in livestock, agricultural economics, agronomy, agribusiness, environmental policy, or related field from an accredited university is required.
Minimum of 10 years of professional work experience with projects focusing on the livestock, environmental mitigation measure, economic growth, value chains, and/or expand agro-processing.
Experience working on similar donor-funded programs in South Asia desired.
Previous experience as a Chief of Party, Project Director, Country Director, or similar senior management position for projects with similar magnitude and complexity in developing countries.
Successful track record of leading US Government-funded projects required; USDA programing preferred.
Commitment to inclusive programming that encourages full participation of individuals regardless of gender, disability status, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or other marginalized status.
Excellent communication skills for a wide audience of stakeholders.
Fluency in English is required, and knowledge of Bangla is a plus.

Bangladeshi nationals encouraged to apply.

Position Description

POSITION TITLE : Communication Specialist

LOCATION : Dhaka

STATUS : Full-time; contingent upon continuation of donor funding

REPORTS TO : Deputy Chief of Party (DCOP)

Winrock International is a non-profit organization that works with people around the world to increase economic opportunities, sustain natural resources, and protect the environment. Winrock strengthens the capacity of women, children, youth, and civil society organizations to actively participate in local and national development and transform their societies. Winrock International implements a five-year USAID-funded counter human-trafficking project entitled "USAID's Fight Slavery and Trafficking-In-Persons (FSTIP) Activity. The goal of FSTIP is to
Enhance the systems, capacity, and sustainability of justice sector actors and institutions.
Prevent human rights violations and increasing awareness of TIP and Child Marriage; and
Strengthen protection of TIP and Child Marriage victims.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Communication Specialist will be responsible to assist the COP/DCOP and component managers in planning and implementing communication activities of FSTIP project. The Communication Specialist will work to publicize the results achieved by FSTIP project, its partner organizations, and volunteer groups (peer leader and ANIRBAN) through designing and publishing high-quality publications and producing video documentaries. S/he will coordinate with national and local government officials, counter-trafficking committees, and volunteer groups in FSTIP's target geographic locations to identify stories to portray vividly the successes of the project through state-of-the-art print materials as well as video documentaries. S/he should produce communication materials following the Winrock International's rules and regulations relating to publications for printing materials and production of video and maintaining the branding and marking policy of USAID. The Communication Specialist should keep in mind that FSTIP is a counter TIP and child marriage project that also emphasizes gender, social inclusion, youth, COVID-19, and the host community in Cox's Bazar, impacted by the Rohingya influx. The Communication Specialist will also implement USAID requirements for making the publications accepted and appreciated by them as the donor of FSTIP Activity.

All interested candidates shall submit their CV with minimum three references and a cover letter in English to this LINK Winrock International » Job Openings

Specific responsibilities:
Develops detailed communication and media plans including event calendars and assists team members in planning and supporting the implementation of events by timely producing communication materials.
Develops content and coordinates creative execution to provide a consistent, targeted, and impactful message.
Builds and maintains solid partnerships with assigned internal clients to better develop, coordinate, direct, and facilitate strategic communications designed to meet the project goals.
Collects issue/event-based messages and information together with photos from component managers and partner staff members to design and publish bi-annual project update and quarterly newsletters with support from the project and partners, and prepares event reports, thematic reports, etc.
Plans, designs and prepares complete project brief, brochure, and annual report and support quality printing
Designs and publishes fact sheet, updates the existing one pager and develops IEC materials with appropriate messages and photos/illustrations.
Designs day-observance plans such as World Day against Trafficking-in-Persons and publishes promotional materials and publications before and after the Day including Twitter message and Facebook postings (Winrock and USAID).
Maintains regular communications with Winrock International's Comms Team for its guidance on publications and uploading items on USAID and Winrock web portals and social media.
Directs in-house and external graphic designers, photographers, and other media production to align thematically with project goals.
Designs and produces high-quality video documentaries on the project's success stories including the case studies of the TIP and CM survivors.
Uploads promotional materials on social media including Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
Contributes ideas for new communication activities, researching and recommending innovative branding techniques aligning with USAID's branding and marking policy.
Prepares and publishes press releases (print, electronic, and online media) on major/important events of FSTIP and publishes newspaper articles on TIP and/or CM issues.
Provides expert inputs in making the publications such as training modules, handbooks, and booklets more attractive and communicative.
Visit project field locations to document events or activities.
Assist COP, DCOP, and the country team in performing other tasks as required.

Master's level/Graduate degree required in Mass Communications and Journalism, English or any relevant subjects from a reputable university.

Experience developing program communications and reports on project success.
Demonstrated experience with all types of social media (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.).

Skills:

Microsoft Office
Strong oral and written communication
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in teams and in a multicultural environment.
Ability to work independently with minimal oversight and manage multiple competing priorities and activities.

About Augmedix

Augmedix (Nasdaq: AUGX) delivers industry-leading, ambient medical documentation and data solutions to healthcare systems, physician practices, hospitals, and telemedicine practitioners.

Augmedix is on a mission to help clinicians and patients form a human connection at the point of care without the intrusion of technology. Augmedix’s solutions extract data from natural physician-patient conversations and convert it to medical notes in real time, which are seamlessly transferred to the EHR. To achieve this, the company’s Ambient Automation Platform uses Automated Speech Recognition and Natural Language Processing, supported by medical documentation specialists.

Leveraging this platform, Augmedix’s solutions relieve clinicians of administrative burden, in turn, reducing burnout and increasing both clinician and patient satisfaction. Augmedix is also leading the revolution in leveraging point-of-care data by making connections between millions of physician-patient interactions and analyzing them to deliver actionable insights that elevate patient care.

About The Role

Reporting directly to the Manager, Communication Design, you will play a crucial role in executing cross-functional creative requests that align with Augmedix's brand strategy. The Communication Designer will partner with Augmedix global marketing on a variety of campaigns and design projects for the United States, Bangladesh, and India. As a member of the internal Brand Team, you will ensure the quality and integrity of the Augmedix brand through the design materials you produce.

To be successful in this role, you should have in-depth knowledge of graphic design, typography, and layout techniques. You should also have experience executing projects from conception to production in a variety of mediums (print, digital, video, web, etc.)

If you are passionate about design, creative, positive, and enjoy working on a variety of projects, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities

Create beautiful and functional visual communications with strong typography, clear hierarchy, and compelling design.
Follow the brand guidelines to align consistent logos, photography, and messaging across design materials, while also customizing to regional audiences (US, Bangladesh, India).
Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and internal stakeholders to understand project requirements and goals.
Execute a wide range of design requests and outputs, including printing, presentation decks, website, social media, content marketing, email, signage, tradeshows/career fairs, video, and more.
Partner with team members to brainstorm, prepare mock-ups, and present ideas.
Work collaboratively with the creative director and copywriters to produce and deliver the final design.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task to deliver high-quality assignments by the deadline.
Can follow instructions and work within pre-approved design templates.
Ability to work independently on multiple projects.
Navigate ambiguous concepts to turn ideas into reality. Flexible with new information or direction.
Open to sharing and receiving thoughtful feedback for improvement.
Attend weekly creative team meetings.
Proactively provide recommendations and solutions.
Provide video shoot assistance as needed.

Requirements

Minimum 5 years of graphic design experience, especially at a creative agency.
Degree in Design, Fine Arts, or a related field is a plus.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Effective working with partially remote teams and a variety of stakeholders.
Flexible for day and night shift work.
Good English communication skills.
Strong working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop), Figma, Google Suite, and Project Management Software (Asana, Jira, etc.).
Familiarity with WordPress, Social Media, Photography, Video Editing, and UX experience is a plus.

job_title: Communication Specialist - USAID's Fight Slavery and Trafficking-In-Persons (FSTIP) Activity - Dhaka Bangladesh
job_description:
Working Title: Senior Technical Officer – Immunization

Internal Title: BD SR PROGRAM OFFICER

Location: Dhaka, Bangladesh

PATH is a global nonprofit dedicated to achieving health equity. With more than 40 years of experience forging multisector partnerships, and with expertise in science, economics, technology, advocacy, and dozens of other specialties, PATH develops and scales up innovative solutions to the world’s most pressing health challenges.

PATH in Bangladesh is currently implementing various high impact projects with the aim of saving and improving the lives of the most vulnerable and underserved women and children in the country. Most recently, the Ministry of Health is preparing to introduce human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines into the routine immunization program, as a part of the national strategy for the prevention and control of cervical cancer. PATH Bangladesh office in collaboration with the Global Policy, Access and Introduction team is now looking for Senior Technical Officer. The person in this position will provide technical assistance to the Ministry of Health and other stakeholders in Bangladesh to advance a portfolio of HPV vaccine technical assistance activities.

The Senior Technical Officer will report to the Team Lead, PATH office in Bangladesh and expected to work closely with the global HPV and national immunization teams. The Senior Technical Officer is expected to mainly provide technical support to MOH/EPI on the national scale up and rollout of HPV vaccines and hand in hand provide technical assistance for the introduction of other new vaccines as per the national plan.

Major Duties of the Senior Technical Officer
Provide Technical Assistance to the Bangladesh National Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI) to support introduction, implementation, improvements, and routinization of HPV vaccinations in the national program.
In partnership with the EPI program, coordinate the development of a chronogram detailing the introduction roadmap for HPV vaccines.
Review findings from the HPV demonstration project implemented in Bangladesh in 2015/2016 and summarize lessons learned (in a written document and PowerPoint presentation) for adaptation to the national HPV vaccine implementation and introduction plan of the Bangladesh EPI program.
Through consultative workshop with the EPI program and in-country partners, adapt existing HPV training material and resources for the Bangladesh context, leveraging existing HPV vaccine training materials already used successfully in other countries and those created for the HPV demonstration project in Bangladesh.
At the request of the EPI manager and in coordination with in-country partners, provide trainings, capacity building, and technical support in areas of infection prevention and control, immunization practices, service provision, data reporting, risk communication, demand generation, and other activities that facilitate high coverage of HPV vaccine.
Serve as a focal person for PATH’s HPV vaccine-related work in Bangladesh.
Assist in the management of PATH’s in-country immunization teams.
Provide technical support to the MOH/EPI and sub-national level health managers (Civil Surgeon/CHO/UH&FPO) in HPV vaccine and other new vaccine introduction and related issues.
Coordinate the international and national support provided by PATH to EPI in close consultation with the MOH/EPI.
Work closely and collaboratively with other in country partners such as UNICEF, WHO, and other key partners in providing support for HPV vaccine delivery.
Actively engage in internal and external team meetings and teleconferences to provide country update, discuss on issues and identify solutions.
Stay current with latest technical knowledge/experience regarding HPV vaccine introduction, and other new vaccines of priority to the government of Bangladesh.
Collaborate with Advocacy and communication team (in-country and global) and support EPI and regions in identifying appropriate social mobilization and demand generation activities and strategies for the HPV vaccine delivery and uptake, as relevant to the request and need identified by the Bangladesh EPI program and in-line with funding parameters.
Properly communicate/report results of technical assistance to in-country leadership and immunization team, Global HPV team and other external stakeholders as required.
Participate in the PATH-wide HPV Technical Assistance (TA) team activities, such as regular teleconferences, email collaboration with other PATH officers in other countries, face-to-face meetings, sharing of experiences and information, etc.
Provide additional support as necessary to build the portfolio of PATH Bangladesh or Global Policy, Access and Introduction team.
Any other duties as assigned by the In country supervisor / Hub office
Travel domestically, regionally and/or internationally, as required.
Required Skills

Required Experience
Master’s Degree in Public Health/ Epidemiology/ Social Sciences/ or related field, from a reputable institute.
Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience in vaccines and immunization with demonstrated skills in new vaccine introduction & implementation, specific experience with HPV vaccines highly desirable.
Demonstrated experience in employing epidemiological and operational skills in planning and programing national rollout of health program with particular emphasis to immunization and new vaccine implementation.
In-depth knowledge of immunization systems and country immunization programs. Specific knowledge of the structure and operations of the Bangladesh Expanded Program on Immunization desirable.
Proven ability to multi-task and collaborate work effectively with senior staff, colleagues, donors, partner organizations, stakeholders, local institutions, and others at all levels.
Ability to work in a complex environment with multiple tasks, short deadlines, and an emphasis on quality.
Excellent analytical, communication, presentation and report writing skills.
Excellent skills in facilitation, team building and coordination.
Fluency in English and Bangla required.
Proficiency in application of Adobe Acrobat and Microsoft Office Suite with an emphasis on proficiency in Word, PowerPoint and SharePoint.
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a multi-site organization and in a team-based structure.
Knowledge of HPV and cervical cancer epidemiology, HPV vaccines, and reproductive health in developing country contexts.
Demonstrated ability to support program planning and evaluation in developing country contexts, preferably with vaccination programs.
Demonstrated ability to work in a multi-country, team-based organizational structure.
Strong experience in country or community-based field experience with vaccine delivery.
Experience in projects that involve liaising with government institutions, WHO, UNICEF, Gavi, and/or other stakeholders and NGOs.
Must have legal authorization to work in Bangladesh.

PATH is dedicated to diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.



Every qualified applicant will be considered for employment. PATH does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, age, national origin, marital status, disability status, political ideology, military or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.




PATH has become aware of scams involving false job offers. *
Please Advise
PATH will never ask for a fee during any stage of the recruitment process.
All active jobs are advertised directly on our career page.
Official PATH emails will always arrive from a @path.org address or @silkroad.com address.
Please report any suspicious communications to careersitehelp@path.org

About Augmedix

Augmedix (Nasdaq: AUGX) delivers industry-leading, ambient medical documentation and data solutions to healthcare systems, physician practices, hospitals, and telemedicine practitioners.

Augmedix is on a mission to help clinicians and patients form a human connection at the point of care without the intrusion of technology. Augmedix’s solutions extract data from natural physician-patient conversations and convert it to medical notes in real time, which are seamlessly transferred to the EHR. To achieve this, the company’s Ambient Automation Platform uses Automated Speech Recognition and Natural Language Processing, supported by medical documentation specialists.

Leveraging this platform, Augmedix’s solutions relieve clinicians of administrative burden, in turn, reducing burnout and increasing both clinician and patient satisfaction. Augmedix is also leading the revolution in leveraging point-of-care data by making connections between millions of physician-patient interactions and analyzing them to deliver actionable insights that elevate patient care.

Head of People, Bangladesh is a key role within our global People team. Reporting to the Head of HR based in San Francisco (US), you will be working across a variety of HR programs and initiatives to ensure the Bangladesh leadership and teams have the support they need to be successful. As the Head of People, you will be responsible for executing key people-related programs including recruiting, onboarding, cultural initiatives, engagement and retention, performance management, career development, and human resources. We’re looking for someone with significant experience with all aspects of people operations and HR strategy but who also has an entrepreneurial spirit. Partnering with local management to ensure a great work environment for our employees, and providing advice and coaching to local management in all people matters.

Job Responsibilities

Develop comprehensive strategic recruiting and retention plans to meet the human capital needs aligned with business goals.
Develop and implement human resources policies to support strategic objectives in line with the land of law.
Take a lead role in transforming and strengthening the organizational culture, ensuring that the company values and approach are displayed.
Regularly coach, mentor and support senior and high potential colleagues to identify individual strengths and development needs, develop and maintain effective relationships and encourage retention.
Own applicant-facing management of our brand on and off platforms including our careers page as well as platforms such as Facebook, LinkedIn, local job sites, etc.
Strengthen our culture; work with the management team to organize and execute team-building events and keep company culture top of mind.
Create and expand on HR tools and processes, advise the executive team on employment laws, benefits options, compensation strategies, etc.
Be the source of truth and owner for all people operations including but not limited to: Hiring, Human Resources, employment laws, on-boarding/off-boarding processes, and other people operations functions.
Work closely with Country Director (Bangladesh) to revamp employee development processes to enhance the employee experience and increase productivity and retention.
Collaborate and support the US and India for any HR support or any other assigned projects.

Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources/Management, Business Administration, or related field required; Master's degree preferred.
15+ years of work experience in HR leadership roles.
Solid understanding of employment regulation in line with the land of law and general HR best practices.
Solid experience in employee engagement, employee benefits, employee service, and recruiting.
Experience in “mass” recruitment is highly preferred.
Experience in global companies with US offices highly preferred.

Key Skills

Excellent communication skills.
Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
Superior interpersonal skills.
Strong Decision-making skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented, Results-driven.
Excellent people management skills.
A self-motivated and can-do attitude.
Be an ambassador of Augmedix culture and values.

Augmedix is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, gender identity, race, religious creed, color, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation including being transgender and/or any other protected bases.
